DOCNAME: CASE OF MITREVSKI v. "THE FORMER YUGOSLAV REPUBLIC OF MACEDONIA"
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in the village of PERSON and lives in GPE .
CARDINAL . On DATE his brother ( “ the plaintiff ” ) brought a civil action against him for a declaration that he owned CARDINAL of a plot of land and a house ( “ the property ” ) .
CARDINAL . A hearing on DATE was adjourned because the applicant had not been duly summoned .
CARDINAL . At a hearing on DATE the court ordered the plaintiff to provide further particulars of his claim . It further sought to obtain a deed of gift dating from DATE .

CARDINAL . According to the ORG , at a hearing on DATE the court granted the plaintiff 's request to carry out an on - site inspection ( увид ) and to examine witnesses . The applicant arrived late at the hearing , but was informed of the place and time of the next hearing . The Government submitted a barely legible copy of the record , which had been signed by the applicant .

CARDINAL . At the on - site inspection on DATE , the trial court heard evidence from CARDINAL witnesses concerning the history of the property . The record indicates that the applicant was absent , even though he had been duly summoned .
CARDINAL . A hearing fixed for DATE was adjourned at the applicant 's request .

CARDINAL . At a hearing on DATE the plaintiff 's counsel stated that his client had suffered a stroke and was not medically fit to give a statement . The court ordered him to submit a medical report and on DATE in DATE , the plaintiff 's counsel submitted a medical report certifying that his client was not medically fit to give a statement .
CARDINAL . On DATE the composition of the bench changed and the hearing restarted .
CARDINAL . At a hearing on DATE the applicant disputed the plaintiff 's legal capacity to bring the proceedings . He stated , inter alia :
“ ... [ NORP reviewing the file , I have concerns as to the validity of the plaintiff 's letters of authority ... We propose that the court assess his capacity ... ”

CARDINAL . According to the court record , the court ruled that the next hearing would be held on DATE on - site in order to assess the plaintiff 's health and the validity of his signature on the letter of authority . It further noted that those present should consider the announcement of the next hearing as equivalent to service of a court summons . The applicant and his counsel both attended the hearing .

CARDINAL . On DATE the court held a hearing at the scheduled time , but in the court room instead of on - site . The court heard evidence from the plaintiff and established the validity of the letter of authority . It further read the record of the on - site inspection of DATE and the witnesses ' statements . It noted that the applicant was absent , even though he had been duly summoned . Following the hearing , the trial court gave a decision declaring the plaintiff to be the owner of the property and ordered the applicant to recognise his title . It based its findings on a court decision of DATE by which the plaintiff had been declared heir of the property . It further established that he had lived in the house and had had actual possession ( владение ) of the property since . The trial court based its decision on considerable evidence : an expert opinion ; a record of the on - site inspection ; statements of witnesses ; and other physical evidence .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant appealed , arguing , inter alia , that he had been deprived of the opportunity to participate in the proceedings . He said that he had been prevented from attending the hearing on DATE as it was held in the court room , instead of on - site as scheduled . He submitted that that failure could be regarded as a substantial defect in the proceedings , contrary to section DATE ) of LAW ( see “ Relevant domestic law ” below ) . He further complained that the trial court had taken into consideration the statements of the witnesses from the on - site hearing of DATE which had been held in his absence .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG dismissed the applicant 's appeal and upheld the lower court 's decision finding no grounds to depart from the reasons given . Concerning the applicant 's complaints about the hearing of DATE , it stated :

“ ... [ The applicant ] was duly summoned as he attended the hearing of DATE when the date and time for the hearing were fixed . Therefore , he was obliged to appear in court and depending on whether the plaintiff was also present , it was for the court to decide whether it would visit the plaintiff in his home or hold the hearing in the court room . As the plaintiff appeared in the court ... it was not necessary to go on - site ... [ The applicant ] was properly summoned and has failed to justify his absence ... ”
CARDINAL . As regards the applicant 's complaints concerning the examination of the witnesses at the on - site hearing on DATE , the court stated , inter alia :

“ ... [ The applicant 's ] complaints that the court examined the witnesses at the hearing on DATE in his absence are ill - founded , as he failed to attend , despite having been duly summoned ... If [ the applicant ] had attended the hearing , he would have been able to discuss and challenge their statements , as well as to call other witnesses for examination ... ”

CARDINAL . At the material time section CARDINAL(CARDINAL ) of LAW ( ORG за парничната постапка ) ( “ the Act ” ) provided that the court should summon the parties and any other persons whose presence was required in due time .

CARDINAL . Section CARDINAL of the Act provided that hearings were normally to take place in the court . The court could decide to hold a hearing outside the court LOC if it was considered necessary and/or would save time or reduce costs .

CARDINAL . Section CARDINAL(CARDINAL ) of the LAW laid down that if a hearing was adjourned , the court was required where possible to inform those present immediately of the time and venue of the next hearing .

CARDINAL . Section CARDINAL(CARDINAL ) of the LAW provided that civil proceedings were substantially defective if the court did not apply or incorrectly applied a statutory provision or failed to take into account a circumstance which would or could have influenced the adoption of a lawful and just decision .

CARDINAL . Section CARDINAL(CARDINAL)(CARDINAL ) of the Act provided that proceedings were substantially defective if a party was deprived of the opportunity to participate in them by unlawful conduct , such as the absence of a proper summons .
